intro: Hypericum peplidifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved St. John's wort, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, typically from July to August. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are densely arranged along the stems, giving it a compact appearance. It thrives in well-drained, sunny habitats and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Hypericaceae family.
